refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Actions represent operations that the user can be perform, along with some information how it should be presented in the interface. Each action provides methods to create icons, menu items and toolbar items representing itself.

As well as the callback that is called when the action gets activated, the following also gets associated with the action:
a name (not translated, for path lookup)
a label (translated, for display)
an accelerator
whether label indicates a stock id
a tooltip (optional, translated)
a toolbar label (optional, shorter than label)
The action will also have some state information:
visible (shown/hidden)
sensitive (enabled/disabled)

Apart from regular actions, there are toggle actions, which can be toggled between two states and radio actions, of which only one in a group can be in the "active" state. Other actions can be implemented as GtkAction subclasses.

Each action can have one or more proxy menu item, toolbar button or other proxy widgets. Proxies mirror the state of the action (text label, tooltip, icon, visible, sensitive, etc), and should change when the action's state changes. When the proxy is activated, it should activate its action.

refsect2.title: struct GtkAction
refsect2.para: The GtkAction struct contains only private members and should not be accessed directly.

refsect2.title: gtk_action_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkAction* gtk_action_new (const gchar *name, const gchar *label, const gchar *tooltip, const gchar *stock_id);
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkAction object. To add the action to a GtkActionGroup and set the accelerator for the action, call gtk_action_group_add_action_with_accel().

listitem.simpara: A unique name for the action
the label displayed in menu items and on buttons
the stock icon to display in widgets representing the action

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_get_name ()
refsect2.para: Returns the name of the action.

listitem.simpara: the name of the action. The string belongs to GTK+ and should not be freed.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_is_sensitive ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether the action is effectively sensitive.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the action and its associated action group are both sensitive.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_get_sensitive ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether the action itself is sensitive. Note that this doesn't necessarily mean effective sensitivity. See gtk_action_is_sensitive() for that.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the action itself is sensitive.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_is_visible ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether the action is effectively visible.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the action and its associated action group are both visible.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_get_visible ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether the action itself is visible. Note that this doesn't necessarily mean effective visibility. See gtk_action_is_sensitive() for that.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the action itself is visible.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_activate ()
refsect2.para: Emits the "activate" signal on the specified action, if it isn't insensitive. This gets called by the proxy widgets when they get activated.
It can also be used to manually activate an action.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_create_icon ()
refsect2.para: This function is intended for use by action implementations to create icons displayed in the proxy widgets.

listitem.simpara: the size of the icon that should be created.
a widget that displays the icon for this action.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_create_menu_item ()
refsect2.para: Creates a menu item widget that proxies for the given action.

listitem.simpara: a menu item connected to the action.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_create_tool_item ()
refsect2.para: Creates a toolbar item widget that proxies for the given action.

listitem.simpara: a toolbar item connected to the action.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_connect_proxy ()
refsect2.para: Connects a widget to an action object as a proxy. Synchronises various properties of the action with the widget (such as label text, icon, tooltip, etc), and attaches a callback so that the action gets activated when the proxy widget does.
If the widget is already connected to an action, it is disconnected first.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_disconnect_proxy ()
refsect2.para: Disconnects a proxy widget from an action. Does not destroy the widget, however.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_get_proxies ()
refsect2.para: Returns the proxy widgets for an action.

listitem.simpara: a GSList of proxy widgets. The list is owned by the action and must not be modified.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_connect_accelerator ()
refsect2.para: Installs the accelerator for action if action has an accel path and group. See gtk_action_set_accel_path() and gtk_action_set_accel_group()

Since multiple proxies may independently trigger the installation of the accelerator, the action counts the number of times this function has been called and doesn't remove the accelerator until gtk_action_disconnect_accelerator() has been called as many times.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_disconnect_accelerator ()
refsect2.para: Undoes the effect of one call to gtk_action_connect_accelerator().
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_block_activate_from ()
refsect2.para: Disables calls to the gtk_action_activate() function by signals on the given proxy widget. This is used to break notification loops for things like check or radio actions.
This function is intended for use by action implementations.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_unblock_activate_from ()
refsect2.para: Re-enables calls to the gtk_action_activate() function by signals on the given proxy widget. This undoes the blocking done by gtk_action_block_activate_from().
This function is intended for use by action implementations.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_set_accel_path ()
refsect2.para: Sets the accel path for this action. All proxy widgets associated with the action will have this accel path, so that their accelerators are consistent.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_set_accel_group ()
refsect2.para: Sets the GtkAccelGroup in which the accelerator for this action will be installed.
Since 2.4

listitem.para: The GtkActionGroup this GtkAction is associated with, or NULL (for internal use).
When TRUE, empty menu proxies for this action are hidden.
Whether the action is considered important. When TRUE, toolitem proxies for this action show text in GTK_TOOLBAR_BOTH_HORIZ mode.
The label used for menu items and buttons that activate this action.
A unique name for the action.
A shorter label that may be used on toolbar buttons.
The stock icon displayed in widgets representing this action.
Whether the toolbar item is visible when the toolbar is in a horizontal orientation.
Whether the toolbar item is visible when the toolbar is in a vertical orientation.

refsect2.title: The "activate" signal
refsect2.para: The "activate" signal is emitted when the action is activated.

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4
